definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Other excellent sources of C include kiwifruit, broccoli, and of course oranges.
sentences.chinese: 其他富含維生素C食品包括獼猴桃，花椰菜和橙子。

sentences.english: Add a little grated orange zest.
Turmeric is mildly aromatic and has scents of orange or ginger.
sentences.chinese: 薑黃粉氣味芬芳，發出一種橙子和生薑的氣味。

sentences.english: Tall as she was she couldn't reach the oranges.
sentences.chinese: 她雖然長得這麼高，仍夠不着那些橙子。

sentences.english: Oh. Really? That could be bad for your oranges.
sentences.chinese: 哦，真的嗎？那對你的橙子來說真是壞消息。

sentences.english: Basket. The number of the orang is my age.
sentences.chinese: 橙子的數量就是我的年齡。

sentences.english: Album cut from the 1989 XTC album Oranges & Lemons.
sentences.chinese: 從1989年XTC專輯橙子和檸檬切開的相冊。

sentences.english: Using small sharp knife, cut off peel and white pith from oranges.
sentences.chinese: 使用小的鋒利的刀，把橙子皮削掉。

sentences.english: When I was in Thailand, " he says, "I saw a street girl with an orange.
sentences.chinese: 在泰國時，我看見自己只有一個橙子的童妓。

sentences.english: An "orange flag", a half-moon orange slice and a speared cherry, is the standard garnish on a whisky sour.
sentences.chinese: 這種雞尾酒的裝飾是使用半圓型的橙子片和櫻桃。

sentences.english: If everybody’s wondering about apples, go wonder about oranges.
sentences.chinese: 如果大家都在思考蘋果，那你就去思考橙子。

sentences.english: The great advantage of home-grown oranges is their magnificent flavour.
sentences.chinese: 自產橙子的巨大優勢是其極好的味道。

sentences.english: She juiced an orange for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 她用一直橙子榨汁作爲早餐飲料。

sentences.english: I am received come over, have orange and firedrake fruit.
sentences.chinese: 我接過來，有橙子和火龍果。

definition: pomelo (Citrus maxima or C. grandis)/shaddock/oriental grapefruit
